title: Figma Unveils AI-Powered Erase, Isolate, and Expand Tools for Seamless In-App Image Editing

paragraphs.content: Figma launched three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—on December 10, 2025, enabling precise edits directly within Figma Design and Draw without exporting to external software. These tools integrate into a revamped toolbar alongside features like Remove background and Crop, addressing common workflow frustrations for designers and marketers. Available immediately to Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plan users with AI enabled, they emphasize granular control without text prompts.

paragraphs.content: The tools power in-house models for tasks like object removal with an improved lasso selector and background extension for new aspect ratios. Industry observers note this reduces platform-switching, such as from Figma to Photoshop, streamlining campaign mockups and UI iterations. Figma positions these as part of over 150 features released in 2025, with expansion planned across more products in 2026.

sections.title: Breakdown of Erase, Isolate, and Expand Capabilities

paragraphs.content: **Erase object** lets users select and remove unwanted elements via an enhanced lasso tool, automatically filling backgrounds naturally for clean mockups. **Isolate object** separates subjects from backgrounds, allowing adjustments like blur, lighting, shadow, color, or desaturation while preserving image traits. These non-generative features prioritize direct selection over prompts, consolidating with high-use actions like Remove background in one toolbar.

paragraphs.content: **Expand image** intelligently extends backgrounds to fit formats like square-to-landscape conversions without distortion, ideal for web banners or social media. The unified toolbar also supports annotations, text overlays, and color changes for one-stop editing. Figma's updates make precision work intuitive, closing loops on tedious exports for product shots and prototypes.

primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: Sources praise the tools for minimizing dependencies on Adobe or Canva, enabling faster iterations in cross-functional reviews and test variations. ContentGrip highlights benefits for marketers finessing visuals in-context, while TechCrunch notes Figma catching up to rivals with years of similar object removal tech. The launch coincided with Adobe's ChatGPT integrations, where Figma partnered in October 2025.

Figma plans broader rollout in 2026, building on 2025's drawing and prototyping enhancements. Early reactions from YouTube demos celebrate ending "juggling between design tools" for in-file refinements. Overall, the suite advances Figma toward a full visual design hub with assistive AI.
